sentences: Minu esimene külastus pariisis oli aastal 2015.
Pariis on üks ilusamaid linnu maailmas.
context: The word 'pariisi' is the elative case form of 'Pariis', which means Paris in English. In Estonian, the elative case indicates movement away from or out of a location. So 'pariisi' can mean 'from Paris' or 'out of Paris'. It's commonly used when talking about leaving or coming from Paris, as in 'tuli Pariisist' (came from Paris) where 'Pariisist' would be the elative form.
